subject: Web3
title: The ICO Craze and Crackdown
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The ICO Craze and Crackdown.

hook.text: In 2017, startups raised $6 billion through ICOs â€” initial coin offerings. Most had no product, just a whitepaper.

buildup.text: Anyone could launch a token and sell it to the public. No registration, no prospectus, no investor protections.

discovery.text: The SEC declared that most ICO tokens were unregistered securities. Selling them without approval broke federal law.

twist.text: Over 80% of ICO projects failed or turned out to be scams. Investors lost billions with no legal recourse.

climax.text: The ICO boom and bust taught regulators and investors that unregulated token sales are gambling, not investing.

punchline.text: Six billion raised on promises. Most of it vanished with the whitepapers.

quiz.question: What did the SEC determine about most ICO tokens?
options: They were unregistered securities sold in violation of federal law
